items.title: Ruben Amorim sacked as Man United manager
items.summary: Manchester United have sacked boss Ruben Amorim after a breakdown in his relationship with the club, in particular director of football Jason Wilcox.

items.title: Amorim hits out: I'm Utd manager, not the coach
items.summary: Ruben Amorim has raised doubts over his future at Manchester United by saying he wants to be the "manager, not the coach."

items.title: Sources: Rosenior in London, close to Chelsea job
items.summary: Chelsea are moving closer to the appointment of Liam Rosenior as their new head coach after the 41-year-old arrived in London on Sunday, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Bayern wonderkid Karl reveals Real Madrid dream
items.summary: Bayern Munich wonderkid Lennart Karl has revealed that we "definitely" wants to play for Real Madrid at some point in his career, calling the Spanish giants his "dream club."

items.title: City injuries worry Pep: Gvardiol 'doesn't look good'
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said he has "concerns" after a number of defenders suffered injuries in a 1-1 draw with Chelsea in the Premier League on Sunday.

items.title: Amorim sacked by Man Utd after 14 months in charge
items.summary: Manchester United sack manager Ruben Amorim after he criticised the club's hierarchy following Sunday's 1-1 draw at Leeds.

items.title: Ruben Amorim sacked by Manchester United after losing power struggle over transfers
items.summary: Head coach goes after outburst at Leeds game He oversaw worst Premier League finish of 15th Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United after 14 months as their head coach. The Portuguese departs after a power struggle with the hierarchy over transfer policy, with Amorim demanding his colleagues in the recruitment department ‚Äúdo their job‚Äù after Sunday‚Äôs draw at Leeds. Amorim believed United were prepared to back him in the January window should a major signing become available but then said last Friday: ‚ÄúWe have no conversation to have any change in the squad.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Leicester poised to sign full-back Ashleigh Neville from Tottenham
items.summary: Spurs sign Julie Blakstad after bringing in Hanna Wijk Arsenal sign Sweden right-back Smilla Holmberg Leicester are poised to sign the experienced full-back Ashleigh Neville from their fellow Women‚Äôs Super League club Tottenham, the Guardian understands, after the north London club completed deals for Julie Blakstad and Hanna Wijk. According to sources, an agreement has been reached for Neville‚Äôs move. Tottenham on Monday announced the signing of the Norway international Blakstad on as free transfer, after her contract expired at Hammarby. The 24-year-old former Manchester City player can operate as a winger, wing-back or left-back. Neville is Tottenham‚Äôs longest-serving player, having been with the club for eight and a half years, and has been a core part of their side since promotion to the second tier in 2017. A fans‚Äô favourite, she became in February 2025 the first player to make 100 WSL appearances for Tottenham and was a key part of the side that reached the club‚Äôs first Women‚Äôs FA Cup final in 2024. Neville‚Äôs switch to Rick Passmoor‚Äôs Leicester is expected to bring regular starting opportunities after Tottenham also signed the Sweden full-back Wijk. The 22-year-old Wijk can, like Neville, play at left-back or right-back and Tottenham are evolving their squad. Leicester are understood to be targeting players with more WSL experience, having often had the youngest average age in the division in their starting side this season. Continue reading...

items.title: Man Utd bevestigt vertrek Amorim en aanstelling Fletcher
items.summary: De clubleiding van Manchester United heeft manager R√∫ben Amorim ontslagen. Dit is maandagochtend bekend geworden. De Portugees was sinds november 2024 actief op Old Trafford, waar hij interim-coach Ruud van Nistelrooij opvolgde.

items.title: Engelse media zien Reijnders opleven bij Man City: 'Hij fleurde het team op'
items.summary: Tijjani Reijnders heeft zich na een lastige fase herpakt bij Manchester City. De Nederlander maakte zondagavond zijn derde doelpunt in de laatste vier duels en leek daarmee ook de matchwinner te worden tegen Chelsea. Hoewel Man City de overwinning in the dying seconds alsnog uit handen gaf, deelden Engelse media na afloop genoeg complimenten uit aan Reijnders.

items.title: Wintertransfers Eredivisie seizoen 2025/26: alle clubs op een rij
items.summary: De transferperiode is weer losgebarsten. In dit overzicht van VI vind je alle afgeronde, door clubs bevestigde, wintertransfers van de achttien Eredivisie-clubs. Clubs in Nederland kunnen tot en met 3 februari spelers aantrekken.

items.title: Britain's Jones claims biggest win of career over Navarro
items.summary: Great Britain's Fran Jones claimed the biggest win of her career so far to defeat world No 15 Emma Navarro in the first round of the ASB Classic.

items.title: Ref Watch: Why Wirtz goal was given onside by VAR...
Premier League: 10 talking points from the weekend‚Äôs football
items.summary: Nuno lets a golden opportunity slip, Viktor Gy√∂keres does everything but score and Benjamin Sesko struggles again Calum McFarlane‚Äôs unexpected battle with Pep Guardiola brought back memories of the 2021 League Cup final, when Ryan Mason, Tottenham‚Äôs 29-year-old interim coach, faced the significant task of trying to outsmart one of the greatest managers in the game‚Äôs history. For Mason there was the added baggage of Spurs‚Äô 13-year trophy drought; for McFarlane, making his senior management debut, it was Chelsea‚Äôs astonishingly bad recent record against Manchester City. Four and a half years have passed since Chelsea last beat Guardiola‚Äôs side, when Thomas Tuchel‚Äôs team triumphed in the Champions League final, and a draw on Sunday took that winless run to 12 matches. But Enzo Fern√°ndez‚Äôs injury-time equaliser, combining with the midweek upheaval at Stamford Bridge, made it a triumphant point, something Enzo Maresca didn‚Äôt achieve against City during his tenure. Taha Hashim Match report: Manchester City 1-1 Chelsea Match report: Fulham 2-2 Liverpool Match report: Bournemouth 2-3 Arsenal Match report: Leeds 1-1 Manchester United Match report: Tottenham 1-1 Sunderland Continue reading...

items.title: Africa‚Äôs superpowers assemble for Cup of Nations knockout stages
items.summary: Cameroon and hosts Morocco could soon be joined by Nigeria and Egypt at the business end of the tournament For a decade or more, a familiar theme of Cups of Nations has been how the pyramid of African football has been growing little taller but much broader. African sides came no closer to really challenging at a World Cup, but the range of teams capable of beating the continent‚Äôs elite, of getting to the knockout stage of the Cup of Nations, was becoming more diverse. Perhaps, though, a new phase is beginning. It‚Äôs dangerous always to read too much into the performance of one side at one tournament, but in Qatar in 2022 Morocco at last broke through the quarter-final barrier and became the first African side to reach a World Cup semi-final. And now, in the Cup of Nations Morocco are hosting, the traditional powers are reasserting themselves. There is yet to be a real surprise in the tournament and, halfway through the round of 16, the prospect is of the highest-powered list of quarter-finalists in history. Continue reading...

items.title: Rosenior deserves Chelsea chance, says Rooney
items.summary: Wayne Rooney says Liam Rosenior is as good a coach as he has worked with and deserves the chance to be Chelsea manager.
